message.body: just a few hours longer than mine
Driving v. flying makes a difference
I'd rather drive in a lot of cases
yeah, the driving offers more distraction
Is it just me, or is it weird moving in the opposite direction from the person you want to be with?
Honestly, I was glad to be heading home
After a week of operating on a really abnormal schedule, yeah.
I've been operating on very little sleep for too long
Where did you sleep? Wasn't Josh moving in?
Lee and Val slept downstairs on my bed
Devoid of furniture and the like?
I moved all my stuff out yesterday so they could install carpet
Josh wasn't around so it's still empty
Too much time to think now?
she emailed me. and text me
I wrote her an email, since she didn't have my address
she wrote me a few after that

"Ugh. This is going to be difficult, huh? This morning I woke up at around six, and I dreaded opening my eyes because I knew you weren't there. I'm not a phone person either, but I imagine my life won't be that exciting to you when you are so far away. I found out what store I'm going to. And I should find out my schedule tomorrow. Tonight, I am reading a book and drinking beer alone. I'm kind of looking forward to it. It's just really weird because for a week and a half you were part of my life every single day, and now that you're not around I don't even have to email you or text you or anything. And I feel like I want to but what if I have nothing to say? I just want to think that even if you aren't here, you are still present in some sort of way, and I don't want to feel differently about you tomorrow than I did yesterday. Because that feeling was awesome. Is awesome.
Anyway, if that Facebook post was about me, I thank you. If not, never mind.
Xo"
Talking on the phone is annoying
I was doing it for a month.
I don't think she has a webcam
Stop putting up barriers where there might not be any
Well, you need to be careful
Because if you're insisting on being pessimistic and she's of questionable confidence, it will fall apart
Because she'll probably be able to pick up on that, and eventually she'll pull away.
Someone needs to be the driving force.
her text from yesterday: "I'm really not sure how this is suppose to work. Am I supposed to text you? Email you? I don't know..."
(Albeit, with no proven, long-term results quite yet)
You should both decide whether you're going to commit to caring/perpetuating the situation.
At least on an emotional level.
If you decide to commit, and to not play the bullshit "intro-to-dating" games, it gets easier.
The emotional connection means you can skip over all that crap.
I feel like we are somehow already there
So there shouldn't be any questions
Just communicate as much as you want to
at least as much as possible considering the length of time involved
Without worrying about how it comes across
My response to her text was basically that nothing has changed, text when you want, email when you want...
I didn't see her during the day when I was there, so that aspect hasn't changed
Amy said that I'm in love
and I should move to pittsburg to be with her
I don't think you should move yet
haha, yeah I don't usually take Amy's advice. On anything
And that was after a year of online/long-distance
Also, being in love is not that big of a deal
I mean, it _is_ but it isn't
you don't fall in love in a week
I'm not saying it's not possible to fall in love in a short amount of time, I'm just saying I don't
hehe, another text she sent me: "I think Walt Whitman was gay. It doesn't matter."
When Adam and I were on the bus yesterday, heading to the airport, some random older guy started up a conversation about how nice it is to see a couple so in love haha
I "loved" Adam after a short period of time
But he quickly got into the circle of people I feel "love" for.
ugh, I hate it when people say that shit
I'm not saying I don't _feel_ for her
I just don't associate that feeling with love in that sense
have you ever seen a definition for the word _love_?
I'm just going by personal definitions
“Love is the active concern for the life and the growth of that which we love.”
I mean it's not that simple of course but it's a start
Well, I think "in love" is more complicated
I kind of hate the term
That definition seems to accurately define what my concept of platonic love is
I feel love for many people
romantic love for me is much more difficult
like I said, I am a recovering co-dependent
But from the opposite side that I am, haha

Codependency is defined as a psychological condition or a relationship in which a person is controlled or manipulated by another who is affected with a pathological condition (as in an addiction to alcohol or heroin); and in broader terms, it refers to the dependence on the needs of or control of another.[1] It also often involves placing a lower priority on one's own needs, while being excessively preoccupied with the needs of others.
Never mind. I was misremembering the definitions.
While you're more control-y than I am, I doubt you were the level of manipulative that it's characterized by
it's definitely the broader aspect of codependency
the addiction part never really applied to me
the controlling part usually just has to do with making sure the person doesn't leave
but that applies to both sides
assuming both parties are co-dependent, which isn't always the case
Someone always has to be the needy one, I think
I realize that doesnt make sense
The one who needs to be placated
that's more textbook in my opinion
Yeah, I have a hard time imagining a scenario where there's close to an equal level of manipulation
My thing is, I don't mind being in a healthy relationship with someone, but I want to have some separation and my own life
I think I'm capable of that these days
and I think I fear getting close to someone because I will simply default to a codependent lifestyle
I will slowly start to care less about my own problems and shift the focus onto them
which is the type of person I tend to be attracted to
Is that the case with her?
The thing that entertains me is that I'm attracted to people who seem to have their shit together
And then shortly thereafter it's revealed that they're just really good at _looking_ like they have their shit together
No, I legitimately think that they have their shit together
Because that's how they present themselves
maybe no one really has their shit together
I have my shit together like 90% of the time.
Intentionally preventing yourself from having *all* of your shit together, but mostly have a solid idea of what's going on with your shit
Val came over and was like, "welcome back, Papa!"
I do find it amusing how I seem to have my shit together more than anyone else while almost trying not to
The best part of not living with people is not having to put on clothes
I'm going to be sad when I move
I thought you were getting roommates?
I will be moving to WC, yes, and getting a roommate ideally, yes
Given the past, would you have any problem with Josh and me doing anything?
Why would that even come up?
Because neither him or me are in exclusive relationships
And we were flirting hardcore at my party.
Huh. He didn't mention anything to me about it. Yeah, I don't really mind
No offense, but it's not like it's something that either one of us would need to discuss with you. Technically.
I'm too dazed to care about much right now
Good. Perfect time to check with you, haha.
I would expect him to talk to me about it though
It's not like we were dating
Essentially, he would have been flirting with a friend of yours
That's not the point. Its jut how it works. Trust me. Its no big deal, I just would expect him to come to me. He told Dan about Amy after all =|
Uh huh. He was hitting on her last Wednesday or something when he was really drunk. He then apologized to Dan about it
Yeah, but Dan's feelings are involved
Well, you're comparing two dissimilar situations
If you and Josh had a drunken hook up, he'd tell me. Not because he has to, but because its just how things are done
And neither of us were drunk.
That's why he didn't say anything
Besides, you are telling me now
I won't be informing you of anything in the future.
Of course not. Except that you wont be informing me
Or to inform me that you don't have to
The point: you don't have to, nor is it expected that you tell me anything
I just want to leave now
When do you leave for Boston?
Pass on the long-distance road trips starting at ~3 am
I'm completely out of it o.O
How is it possible that you can't sleep?
And even though I was tired, I just wasn't falling asleep
I'm in Boston. Wtf. I'm sitting in my truck staring into space. I have no idea what is going on
I don't even know where I'm staying tonight
I don't think I know anyone in Boston
So can't help on that front =(
I really don't like having this much going on at once
You're working. Someone's moving in. And you're in a new relationship.
That's more than usual, perhaps, but it's not an unfathomable amount of change.
I feel sooo much better now
And I wasn't complaining. I'd prefer less at the moment, and there are a few details you missed
So I get this message from Amanda last night: "I'm buying a ticket to Boston. I'll be there Wednesday 9/5. I'll find a hotel for us."
I'm starting to get slightly concerned
She was about too, then got stressed out about it
Maybe being just out of reach is worse than being arms and arms out of reach
Yeah, I made that realization as well
I've come to the conclusion that she is crazy, I just don't know to what extent yet
We already talked about it. Its only $115 round trip
See, you only give me a few details, and then leave me to infer the rest
It was just mentioned. I told her I would let her know once I got here
Could tell her that you'd prefer something closer to the middle of your trip there?
Or find a way to communicate that you need a little bit of "space" or whatever
Well, she starts her new job on the tenth, so it has to be before that
I really don't mind her coming. I mean I do want to see her
It still comes off a bit clingy
Time will tell. I'm just concerned
Just embrace the random happenstance and don't worry about it.
You like her. She likes you.
Ugh, I may be talking to the wrong person
I'm fine. Really. I'm just a bit guarded
I generally tend to be super manage-y about relationships.
And that puts a lot of stress on them.
Its not an intentional thing. It just happens.
I'm still guarded emotionally with Adam, a bit
When I witness certain behavior, I come to certain conclusions
Yeah, but I'm not worrying about the future at all
Its natural. Especially if you like them
I think I'm just better at letting go of my desire to control outcomes when it comes to relationships.
You're better at applying that to life in general; I'm better at applying it to relationships.
There could be tons of problems with dating Adam
At this point, I'm not really concerned with the outcome. It seems more than likely (or usual) that it won't work out. Negative, sure, but I'm basing that on past exerience and logic
so why does it matter if she is batshit insane?
Of course there could, if not just the fact that he lives across the country
That's the LEAST of the possible issues, haha
It doesn't. I'd just like to be aware as soon as possible
Just enjoy what you have while you have it
It's not like you're wasting time
No, I'd say it's the biggest possible issue. Once I establish that she's not, I'm more inclined to go with the flow
What I have? I don't even know what that is
No, I mean for my relationship -- the coast thing is the least of the possible issues
You have a relationship that makes you happier-ish
Eh, it doesn't make me anything right now. I'd say it has the potential to
It doesn't make you anything right now because you're too consumed with worrying about it
So I was looking at hotels. Amanda told me she would take care of it, that she has money and travels in style
